alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Jefferson (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, northwestern Broadwater and north central Jefferson Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 630 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Garrison to 22 miles northeast of Deer Lodge to 16 miles west of Helena. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, East Helena, Wolf Creek, Montana City, Marysville, York, Rimini, Spring Meadow Lake State Park, Canyon Creek, Black Sandy State Park and Austin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 186 and 232. Highway 12 between mile markers 29 and 57. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southwestern and west central Montana.
